alert.note: Alert for Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 4:31PM CDT until July 04 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 431 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Laurel. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laurel, Ellisville and Tuckers Crossing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
